ai_questions.question: For an European patent application filed on 15 March 2023, by when must the filing fee and search fee be paid to avoid any delay in processing?
options: A. By 15 April 2023

ai_questions.question: An applicant filed an international application under PCT (PCT-App) at the International Bureau on 15 January 2023, claiming priority from a previous application filed on 16 January 2022. The application entered the regional phase in the European Patent Office on 15 December 2024. Which of the following fees must be paid by the applicant to effect entry into the European phase according to Rule 159(1) EPC, considering that no early processing was requested?
options: A. The filing fee and the claims fee.
B. The filing fee, the examination fee, and the designation fee.
C. The claims fee, the examination fee, and the designation fee.
D. The filing fee and the renewal fee.

ai_questions.question: If an international application was filed on 15 June 2021, claiming priority from an earlier application filed on 17 May 2020, within what time frame must the applicant file a request for restoration of the priority right to be considered by the EPO under Rule 49ter.2(b)(i) PCT and Article 22 PCT?
options: A. Within one month from 15 June 2023
B. Within two months from 17 May 2021
C. Within one month from 16 July 2023
D. Within two months from 15 June 2021

ai_questions.question: A European patent application EP-Y, filed on 15 June 2023, claimed priority from an earlier French application filed on 14 July 2022. The applicant wishes to enter the European phase early by paying the required fees before the normal deadline. Which of the following steps must be completed by the applicant to validly effect early entry into the European phase according to Article 89(1) EPC?
options: A. Payment of the designation fee only

ai_questions.question: If an intervener files during appeal proceedings and requests appellant status, which of the following fees must they pay according to the case law?
options: A. The opposition fee.
B. The appeal fee.
C. Both the opposition fee and the appeal fee.
D. No additional fee is required.

ai_questions.question: If an applicant wishes to file a European patent application for an invention that has been claimed with priority, within how many months of the filing date must they pay the search fee if early processing is not explicitly requested?
options: A. Within one month.
B. Before the 31-month period expires.
C. No payment required as it is waived for inventions with priority claims.
D. Within three months.

ai_questions.question: According to the Guidelines for Examination in the EPO, if documents are not filed in an official language of the EPO, which of the following statements is true?
options: A. They will be disregarded by the EPO and deemed not received.
B. They will be corrected by the EPO before further processing.

ai_questions.question: If an international application has not designated any inventor by the 31-month deadline, what is the EPO’s next step according to the Guidelines for Examination in the EPO, E-IX, 2.3.4?
options: A. The application is automatically refused without further notice.
B. The applicant is invited to file the designation of inventor within two months.
C. The application is considered withdrawn and cannot be rectified.
D. The EPO waives the requirement for designating an inventor.

ai_questions.question: According to the guidelines, within which time frame must the certified copy of the previous application (priority document) be filed for a European patent application?
options: A. Within 16 months from the filing date of the European patent application

ai_questions.question: If a European divisional application is filed for subject-matter contained in a pending Euro-PCT application, which of the following conditions must be met according to the Guidelines for Examination in the EPO?
options: A. The divisional application can be filed before the Euro-PCT application enters the European phase.
B. The divisional application must be filed on the same day as the parent application.

C. The divisional application may only be filed after the time limit under Rule 159(1) (in conjunction with Art. 22(1) PCT and Art. 22(3) PCT) has expired, provided any requirement of Art. 22(1) PCT which must be fulfilled within that time limit is met.
D. The divisional application can be filed at any time as long as it relates to subject-matter contained in a pending Euro-PCT application.

ai_questions.question: If an original claim for a method of operating a pacemaker containing both 'device features' and 'method features' is amended to include only 'device features', would such an amendment be permissible under Article 123(3) EPC?
options: A. Yes, because the amendment clarifies the scope of protection.

ai_questions.question: If an applicant fails to pay the designation fee for a Euro-PCT application entering the European phase within 31 months from the filing or priority date, what consequence will occur according to Rule 157(2) EPC?

ai_questions.question: If an inventor has not been named in the international application at the expiry of the 31-month time limit, what action can the EPO take?
options: A. The application will be automatically withdrawn.

C. The applicant will be given an indefinite period to rectify the deficiency.
D. The EPO will name a default inventor.

ai_questions.question: You filed a European patent application on 5 February 2023, claiming the priority of an earlier filed European application on 7 March 2022. ai_questions.question: Company XYZ files a European patent application for an invention disclosed at an international exhibition, which closed three months after the initial display of the invention. ai_questions.question: A European patent application was filed with the EPO in Dutch on 15 March 2023, which is an admissible non-EPO language.
